info.name: Spinocerebellar tract, dorsal (posterior)
info.description: The dorsal or posterior spinocerebellar tract carries proprioceptive information from Clark's nucleus (AKA nucleus dorsalis) in the thoracic-lumbar spinal cord to the ipsilateral cerebellum. The tract is located in the dorsal-lateral aspect of the lateral column of the ipsilateral spinal cord and enters the cerebellum via the inferior cerebellar peduncle. The information in this tract comes from proprioceptors in the ipsilateral lower extremity that send their input via large diameter primary afferents to terminate or synapse in Clark's nucleus.
